intro: Silene michelsonii, commonly known as the Michelson’s campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink or white flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene michelsonii is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
